senses.de: Produce a picture or diagram by making lines and marks.
senses.ex: He likes to draw in his free time.

Tips.title: Artistic Use
Tips.description: Used when referring to creating art, not just any picture.

Tips.title: Requires Skill
Tips.description: Implies the ability to depict something accurately with detail.
Tips.example: He learned to draw with amazing precision.

senses.de: Pull or drag something in a specified direction.
senses.ex: She drew the curtain to one side.

Tips.title: Physical Movement
Tips.description: Involves moving an object by pulling it.
Tips.example: Please, draw the blinds for me.

Tips.title: Gentle Action
Tips.description: Suggests careful or gradual action, not sudden or forceful.
Tips.example: She gently drew the door open.

senses.de: Make someone or something come towards a place.
senses.ex: The concert drew a large crowd.

Tips.title: Attraction Context
Tips.description: Commonly used to describe a person or event that attracts attention or interest.
Tips.example: The festival will draw tourists from around the world.

Tips.title: Magnetic Quality
Tips.description: Often associated with an inherent quality that pulls others towards something.
Tips.example: Her charisma drew people to her cause.

senses.de: Arrive at a point in time or a specified point in a process.
senses.ex: As the day of the wedding drew closer, she began to panic.

Tips.title: Time Relation
Tips.description: Indicates an event or moment is approaching or coming to an end.
Tips.example: As the holiday draws near, I get more excited.

senses.de: Extract something from a particular source.
senses.ex: She drew strength from the support of her friends.

Tips.title: Source Essential
Tips.description: Means taking something needed from a larger pool or source.
Tips.example: He drew inspiration from nature for his poetry.

senses.de: Reach a conclusion or establish something by reasoning.
senses.ex: From the evidence, we can draw some conclusions.

Tips.title: Reasoning Process
Tips.description: It's about making a logical conclusion from the information given.
Tips.example: Based on the clues, we can draw a conclusion.

senses.de: In games and competitions, to finish with the same score or result as an opponent.
senses.ex: The chess game ended in a draw.

Tips.title: Equal Outcome
Tips.description: Used when two or more parties have the same result in a contest.
Tips.example: The teams will draw if neither scores again.

senses.de: A competition where winners are selected by a random draw.
senses.ex: The winners of the lottery draw are announced.

Tips.title: Luck Based
Tips.description: Refers to an outcome decided by chance, not skill.
Tips.example: They entered their names into the prize draw.

Create.wordDefinition:
Create generally means to make something new that did not exist before.

So while you can create a drawing, you can also create many other things that don't involve drawing, such as a sculpture or a website.

Design.wordDefinition:
Design refers to the process of planning or creating something, while Draw refers to the act of creating a picture or image by hand or with a tool.

Design applies when you are starting a project or creating something new, such as a product, building or website. It involves thinking about the purpose of the project, the needs of the target audience, and the best way to achieve the desired results.

Design is about creating a plan or strategy, while drawing is about creating visuals or images. Both skills are important, but they have different applications.

Doodle.wordDefinition:
Doodle typically refers to a drawing made absentmindedly or without much thought, often done while someone is thinking or listening.

Drawing requires more skill, planning and effort than doodling.

For example, someone might doodle in the margins of their notebook while listening to a lecture, while someone might draw a detailed illustration for a book cover or comic book.

Draft.wordDefinition:
Draft refers to creating a preliminary version or plan of something, such as an essay, a blueprint, or a policy proposal.

Draft is used in more formal or professional contexts, while draw is more commonly used in art or everyday situations.

Outline.wordDefinition:
Outline means to draw the basic shape or form of something without adding too many details. It is commonly used to plan out a design or to create a rough draft before creating a more detailed drawing.

Draw is used when you want to create a more detailed and refined image, while outline is used for creating a basic plan or draft.

Produce.wordDefinition:
Produce means to make or manufacture something, usually on a larger scale.

Draw is applicable when creating visual art, while produce is applicable when manufacturing physical items.

Sketch.wordDefinition:
Sketch means to draw something quickly without many details. Sketching is usually done to capture an idea or an impression.

Sketches can be made using pencils, charcoal, or ink. They can be used to plan a project, illustrate a concept, or even create a preliminary version of a painting.

In simple terms, drawing is a more detailed and finished version of art, while sketching is a rough, quick and simple version of drawing that is usually used for planning or drafting purposes.

Trace.wordDefinition:
Trace means to copy or follow the outlines of an existing image. It involves placing a piece of paper on top of the image and using a pencil to copy its shape.

Drawing is applicable when you want to create a new image or express your creativity. Tracing is applicable when you want to copy an image accurately, for example, when you are tracing a map, a picture, or a design.

In summary, drawing is about creating something new, while tracing is about copying something already existing.

quotes.Text: One always dies too soon or too late. And yet, life is there, finished: the line is drawn, and it must all be added up. You are nothing other than your life.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.Text: I start drawing, and eventually the characters involve themselves in a situation. Then in the end, I go back and try to cut out most of the preachments.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Dr. Seuss

quotes.Text: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Richard Bach

quotes.Text: I can't draw a straight line to save my life. I just can't draw.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Joel Courtney

quotes.Text: I like characters who have faults. I'm drawn to darker people.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Hayley Atwell

quotes.Text: We wanted to draw a line between public life and private life.
quotes.Name: Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo

quotes.Text: In acting, you draw so much on your private life.
quotes.Title: French Actress
quotes.Name: Emmanuelle Riva

quotes.Text: I draw the line between me and my character.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: John Layfield

quotes.Text: I'm drawn to the not-so-perfect character.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Guillermo Diaz

quotes.Text: I've never played for a draw in my life.
quotes.Title: Scottish Coach
quotes.Name: Alex Ferguson
